name: Kentucky Adoption Services Branch
description: The Kentucky Adoption Services Branch is responsible for program oversight and planning in the area of adoption services. The primary focus is timely permanency planning and achievement for committed children in out of home care. DCBS is involved in nearly every adoption in Kentucky, including independent relative and independent non-relative adoption. Services include receiving and processing adoption applications, issuing Foreign Adoption Certificate of Registration for international adoptions, administering the Kentucky Putative Father Registry, and conducting birth parent searches for adult adoptees 21 years and older. The branch also administers the Kentucky Adoption Profile Exchange (KAPE) to identify forever families for children in out of home care who are legally free for adoption.
source: Verified from official Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services website
notes: Branch Manager: Veronica Sears. For help with adoption questions, call toll free (800) 232-5437 or direct (502) 564-2147. The branch can provide certain background information to adult adoptees after receiving a written request for non-identifying information or a court order.
